intro: Canthium kuntzeanum, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Canthium kuntzeanum is often found in moist woodland and savanna habitats.
